summary: This document is a confidential financial timeline detailing payments over $10,000 made by or on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein to various beneficiaries, including potential co-conspirators, from 2013 to 2019. It reveals payments to his pilot, model management entities linked to Jean Luc Brunel, his brother's real estate company, and legal expenses for Alan Dershowitz and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure from whose accounts the documented wire transfers originate. He is accused of conspiring with Jean Luc Brunel and is the payer for legal expenses of associates.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Epstein's longtime pilot, referred to as 'Lawrence P. Visoski'. Received multiple large payments from Epstein, including one for the purchase of a home.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Allegedly conspired with Epstein to lure young European models to the United States for illicit purposes. His company, MC2 Model Management, received payments.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: A lawyer whose legal expenses (via firm Coffey Burlington and his own consulting LLC) were paid by Jeffrey Epstein in connection with the lawsuit 'Doe v. United States of America'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate. Payments were made to her law firm, Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., by Epstein's attorney to cover her legal expenses in the lawsuit 'Giuffre v. Maxwell'.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Identified as one of four co-conspirators given immunity in Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement. Received payments from Epstein, including one jointly with Daniel Groff.

persons.name: Daniel Groff
persons.context: Received a joint payment with Lesley Groff from Epstein in December 2017.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's brother, owner of the real estate company Ossa Properties, which is an affiliate of 301/66 Owners Corpâ€”an entity that received numerous payments.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Epstein's personal attorney who made payments on his behalf, specifically to Ghislaine Maxwell's law firm.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: An attorney for several Epstein accusers who alleged in a civil lawsuit that Epstein had paid for legal expenses and implied a person (redacted) may be a co-conspirator.

connections.description: Allegedly conspired to lure young European models to the United States for illicit purposes. Epstein made payments to Brunel's company, MC2 Model Management.
Epstein was the employer of his longtime pilot, Visoski, and made substantial payments to him, including for the purchase of a home.
Epstein paid for Dershowitz's legal expenses related to a lawsuit filed by an Epstein accuser.
Epstein, through his attorney Darren Indyke, paid for Maxwell's legal expenses in connection with a lawsuit filed against her.
Epstein made payments to Lesley Groff, who was a co-conspirator given immunity in his Non-Prosecution Agreement.
Brothers. Jeffrey Epstein made payments to 301/66 Owners Corp, an affiliate of Mark Epstein's real estate company, Ossa Properties.
Indyke was Epstein's personal attorney and executed financial transactions on his behalf.

events.title: Payment to MC Model Management
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein wires $25,000 to 'MC Model Management', an entity linked to Jean Luc Brunel.

events.title: Payment for Alan Dershowitz's Legal Fees
events.description: Epstein wires $20,532 to Coffey Burlington, the law firm representing Alan Dershowitz in connection with a lawsuit filed by an Epstein accuser.

events.title: Epstein Purchases Home for Visoski
events.description: Epstein wires $1,235,900 to Horizon Title Services for the 'Visoski Purchase of', indicating he bought a home for his pilot, Larry Visoski.

events.title: Payment for Ghislaine Maxwell's Legal Fees
events.description: Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, wires $21,379 to Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., Ghislaine Maxwell's law firm, with a reference to 'Maxwell retainer'.

events.title: Epstein Added as Beneficiary to Butterfly Trust
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was added as a beneficiary to the Butterfly Trust, a financial entity used in several transactions.

locations: 301/66 Owners Corp (property where Epstein allegedly housed young models)
2 (address where Epstein allegedly housed young models, referenced as primary address for a redacted individual)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein made substantial and repeated payments to his pilot, Larry Visoski, including a $1.24 million payment for the purchase of a home.
Epstein financially supported the legal defenses of key associates, paying Alan Dershowitz's legal bills via Coffey Burlington and Ghislaine Maxwell's legal bills via Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.
Payments were made to MC2 Model Management, owned by Jean Luc Brunel, with whom Epstein is accused of conspiring to lure young models for illicit purposes.
Frequent payments were made to '301/66 Owners Corp', an entity affiliated with Ossa Properties, which is owned by Epstein's brother, Mark, and linked to properties where models were allegedly housed.
Lesley Groff, a named co-conspirator granted immunity in Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement, received payments from Epstein.
